figgy.title: Duration not characterized for WAV files ingested.

comments.body:
Checked figgy VMs. They all have mediainfo installed.

```
MediaInfoLib - v22.09
```

figgy-staging2, ~however does not have mediainfo installed.~ Now installed.

I tried re-characterizing this track and duration was not added to the file metadata.
https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/parent/a137ec85-8227-4ddd-84b8-9bb8be9a99b6/6bb3f14a-472e-439c-96ff-6c9c7e2d0f0b

Downloaded the original file and uploaded to a new resource in figgy-staging and the duration was not recorded either.
https://figgy-staging.princeton.edu/catalog/parent/765c6b36-ceb3-45a3-99a3-9e604f276681/8b9e72cd-a82e-440c-a22c-a9e69bf55626

Running mediainfo from the command line on the staging file shows the duration:

```
Complete name                            : /opt/repository/files/6f/ed/47/6fed4769ac9f45c483eb7d3c7ee529f9/08 - Coleman Hawkins Orchestra - Body And Soul.wav
Format                                   : Wave
File size                                : 30.9 MiB
Duration                                 : 3 min 3 s
Overall bit rate mode                    : Constant
Overall bit rate                         : 1 412 kb/s
Album                                    : Smithsonian Collection of Classic Jazz, Vol. 2
Album/Performer                          : Various Artists
Track name                               : Body And Soul
Track name/Position                      : 8
Track name/Total                         : 24
Compilation                              : Yes
Performer                                : Coleman Hawkins Orchestra
Director                                 : Coleman Hawkins Orchestra
Publisher                                : Smithsonian
Genre                                    : Jazz / Jazz
Recorded date                            : 1987 / 1987
Original source form/Name                : Smithsonian Collection of Classic Jazz, Vol. 2
Cover                                    : Yes
Cover type                               : Cover (front)
Cover MIME                               : image/jpeg
PRE-EMPHASIS                             : 0
PRE-GAP                                  : 227
ITRK                                     : 8
IAAR                                     : Various Artists

Audio
Format                                   : PCM
Format settings                          : Little / Signed
Codec ID                                 : 1
Duration                                 : 3 min 3 s
Bit rate mode                            : Constant
Bit rate                                 : 1 411.2 kb/s
Channel(s)                               : 2 channels
Sampling rate                            : 44.1 kHz
Bit depth                                : 16 bits
Stream size                              : 30.9 MiB (100%)
```

On figgy-staging, I uploaded a short test .wav file. Running the mediainfo ruby command yields correct metadata:
```
MediaInfo.from("/opt/repository/files/59/5f/c0/595fc0f81f4744c38c8145634d33f5e2/StarWars3.wav")
```

On the misbehaving track from above ("08 - Coleman Hawkins"), the same command returns an error:

```
MediaInfo.from("/opt/repository/files/6f/ed/47/6fed4769ac9f45c483eb7d3c7ee529f9/08 - Coleman Hawkins Orchestra - Body And Soul.wav")
```

```
NameError (`@pre-emphasis' is not allowed as an instance variable name)
```

The star wars test track does not have a PRE-EMPHASIS metadata element, while the Coleman Hawkins track does. 

Addendum:

This error does not occur when testing locally. Running `MediaInfo.from` on a local copy of the Coleman Hawkins track works fine. :(

I processed the WAV file locally using an audio tag editor called [Kid3](https://kid3.kde.org/). Removed the PRE-EMPHASIS and PRE-GAP tags and uploaded to a new resource on figgy-staging. Characterization ran correctly and the duration was recorded.

https://figgy-staging.princeton.edu/catalog/parent/f8aa5382-3087-46e3-8eb2-06ce2667aceb/b186819a-8af0-41af-9b45-15c72e8c35ac

```
irb(main):005:0> r=Valkyrie::MetadataAdapter.find(:postgres).query_service.find_by(id: "b186819a-8af0-41af-9b45-15c72e8c35ac")
irb(main):006:0> r.original_file.duration
=> ["183.507"]
```

I presume this the offending line, though I'm not sure why it works locally. Instance variables can't have dashes.
https://github.com/greatseth/mediainfo/blob/6cab041d0815141732ecc1a70834e4d560239a27/lib/mediainfo.rb#L120

Proposal:
1. ~Fork mediainfo gem~ fork already exisits.
2. Add a gsub("-", "_") [here](https://github.com/greatseth/mediainfo/blob/6cab041d0815141732ecc1a70834e4d560239a27/lib/mediainfo.rb#L115).
3. Use fork in figgy
4. Create PR in upstream.
Oop, I thought you were gone. There's a branch: fix_mediainfo_parser, that does your proposal.
Re-ran characterization and the issue was resolved.

pul_library_drupal.title: Can we import LibCal events via RSS feed, rather than ical?

comments.body:
To test this the configuration of the feeds importer for events will need to be re-configured to pull field values from the RSS rather than ICS feed. Steps to take in your local environment to test this. 

1. Structure -> Feeds Importers -> LibCal Events - Workshops -> Override
2. First Check The "Mappings" settings under "Processor" and note the fields the feed is looking for. Confirm versions of these exist in the RSS feed.
3. If the mapping is straightforward update the Parser to parse RSS
4. Return to the Processor and re-map the fields. 
5. Go to /import/libcal_events_workshops and update the URL to use the RSS feed. 
6. Test the feed interactively from this page. I'm not entirely sure what will happen to content previously imported via the ICS feed.
